alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 13 at 11:56AM CST until December 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rough and building surf driven by increasing easterly swell will maintain high intensity rip currents through at least Thursday afternoon. Persistence of the swell and dangerous surf will likely maintain high intensity rip currents past Thursday, and this statement will likely be extended into Friday. High surf advisories may be added to this information later today or tonight.
info.instruction: If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline, then swim back to shore once out of the current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island
